benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Remove tags from account

covered: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: Single, multiple, and all-tags removal return 204 with empty body and persist changes (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC19).
Header Validation: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment accepted/omitted (TC04, TC09, TC19).

Query Parameters: tagDef supports collectionFormat=multi, omission (remove all), empty array, large lists, unexpected params, invalid/malformed values, and mixed valid/invalid (TC02, TC03, TC08, TC11, TC13, TC14, TC18, TC20).
Non-Existent/Invalid Resource: Invalid UUID format and non-existent account both yield 400 per spec (TC06, TC07).
Business Rule: AUTO_PAY_OFF constraint enforced (400 when no default payment method) (TC10).
Server/Error Handling & Resilience: 5xx on service down; retry after transient network failure succeeds (TC12, TC16).
Performance/Concurrency (basic): Concurrent deletes across multiple accounts complete within acceptable time (TC17).
Idempotency/No-op: Deleting from an account with no tags returns 204 and no changes (TC05).
gaps: DELETE Concurrency on the same resource: No scenario where two clients delete the same tag(s) on the same account simultaneously (race/idempotency).
Soft delete behavior: No verification whether deletions are soft vs hard (e.g., flags vs physical removal) per DELETE guideline.
Rate limiting/throttling: No tests for 429 Too Many Requests or related headers under burst traffic.
AUTO_PAY_OFF happy path: No success case when default payment method exists (should return 204).
Atomicity on mixed valid/invalid tagDefs: Test asserts 400 but does not verify no tags were removed (all-or-nothing behavior).
Duplicate tagDef values: No scenario validating handling of repeated UUIDs in query (deduplication/idempotency).
Removing a non-applied tag when other tags exist: No explicit no-op case distinct from “no tags on account.”
Error response format: No checks that error responses are application/json and conform to a standard error schema (code/message), as specified by Produces: application/json.
recommendations: Add a race-condition test: two concurrent DELETEs for the same account and tag(s); assert both return 204 and result is consistent (idempotent, no 409).
Verify soft vs hard deletion: ensure tags are not merely flagged deleted, or, if soft delete is used, that behavior is consistent and documented.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: sustained burst of DELETEs leading to 429 with proper Retry-After headers if applicable.
Add success scenario for removing AUTO_PAY_OFF when the account has a default payment method (expect 204).
Assert atomicity for mixed valid/invalid tagDefs: on 400, verify no tags were removed from the account.
Test handling of duplicate tagDef query parameters: duplicates are ignored/deduped and operation still returns 204.
Add no-op scenario for removing a tagDef not applied to the account while other tags are present; expect 204 and no changes.
Validate error response headers/body: check Content-Type application/json and standard error fields for 4xx/5xx responses.
